articles.author: Sam Mednick and Niamh Kennedy, CNN, and Reuters
articles.title: Burkina Faso President Roch Kabore detained in 'safe place' after 'attempted coup d'état' - CNN
articles.description: The President of Burkina, Roch Kaboré is being detained in a "safe place" following an attempted coup d'état in the West African country, two mutinous soldiers told a journalist working for CNN on Monday.

articles.author: Niyi Iyanda
articles.title: NFF President Amaju Pinnick consoles Super Eagles - Pulse Nigeria
articles.description: President of the Nigeria Football Federation (NFF) Amaju Pinnick has commended the Super Eagles run at the Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON).
articles.content:
We [the NFF] are proud of the efforts of the players. They gave their all and tried very hard to win even when they had a numerical disadvantage. It was just not our day, Pinnick stated.
He also com… [+785 chars]

articles.title: Burkina Faso President Roch Kabore detained at military camp by soldiers following mutiny - News24
articles.description: Burkina Faso President Roch Kabore has been detained at a military camp by mutinying soldiers, according to four security sources and a West African diplomat, following heavy gunfire around his residence on Sunday night in the capital Ouagadougou.
articles.content:
• President Roch Kabore has been detained at a military camp by mutinying soldiers in Burkina Faso.
  • Sustained gunfire had rung out from military camps throughout Sunday, along with h… [+2392 chars]

articles.title: Interest rate hike expected this week - BusinessTech
articles.description: South Africa is likely to see at least three interest rate hikes in 2022.
articles.content: South Africas Reserve Bank (SARB) is expected to raise interest rates to 4% at its Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting on 27 January as part of an ongoing hiking cycle, a Reuterspoll of economist… [+2399 chars]

articles.author: Nicole McCain
articles.title: Covid-19: SA records 1 931 new infections and 17 new deaths - News24
articles.description: South Africa recorded 1 931 new Covid-19 infections on Sunday, representing an 8.6% positivity rate.
articles.content:
• South Africa recorded 1 931 new cases of Covid-19 on Sunday.
  • Seventeen deaths were also recorded, bringing the death toll to 94 177.
  • Gauteng recorded 26% of the new cases.
